titles.title: Expanding Opportunity for Minority Depository Institutions (MDIs) Act
Expanding Opportunity for Minority Depository Institutions (MDIs) Act
Expanding Opportunity for MDIs Act
Expanding Opportunity for Minority Depository Institutions Act
Expanding Opportunity for Minority Depository Institutions Act
Expanding Opportunity for MDIs Act
To amend the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 to establish a Financial Agent Mentor-Protégé Program within the Department of the Treasury, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 57 - 0.

action.text: Ms. Waters moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5315.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
Expanding Opportunity for Minority Depository Institutions Act or the Expanding Opportunity for MDIs Act
This bill establishes the Financial Agent Mentor-Protégé Program within the Department of the Treasury. The program provides participating minority deposit institutions and small financial institutions with mentorship regarding becoming a financial agent for Treasury and improving service capacity.
